Uses of Package
org.unc.lac.baboon.actioncontroller

  • Packages that use org.unc.lac.baboon.actioncontroller 
    Package Description
    org.unc.lac.baboon.actioncontroller  
    org.unc.lac.baboon.subscription  
  • Classes in org.unc.lac.baboon.actioncontroller used by org.unc.lac.baboon.actioncontroller 
    Class and Description
    ActionController
    An ActionController is an abstract class defined by An object instance. A TaskController or HappeningController annotated method, member of the class of the object instance. A set of GuardProvider annotated methods, member of the class of the object instance, that are organized in a Map indexed by the guard name corresponding to the GuardProvider.value().
  • Classes in org.unc.lac.baboon.actioncontroller used by org.unc.lac.baboon.subscription 
    Class and Description
    ActionController
    An ActionController is an abstract class defined by An object instance. A TaskController or HappeningController annotated method, member of the class of the object instance. A set of GuardProvider annotated methods, member of the class of the object instance, that are organized in a Map indexed by the guard name corresponding to the GuardProvider.value().
    HappeningActionController
    A HappeningControllerAction is a class defined by An object instance. A HappeningController annotated method, member of the class of the object instance. A set of GuardProvider annotated methods, member of the class of the object instance, that are organized in a Map indexed by the guard name corresponding to the GuardProvider.value().
    TaskActionController
    A TaskAction is an abstract class that inherits from ActionController, defined by An object instance. A TaskController or HappeningController annotated method, member of the class of the object instance. An array of parameters to be used as ActionController.actionMethod arguments. A set of GuardProvider annotated methods, member of the class of the object instance, that are organized in a Map indexed by the guard name corresponding to the GuardProvider.value().
